StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveMedicalProvider]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @PersonId uniqueiden..er, @ProviderName varchar(30), @ProStreet1 varchar(25), @ProStreet2 varchar(25), @ProCity varchar(10), @ProState varchar(2), @ProZip varchar(5), @ProPhone varchar(25) ) AS
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM [ACP].[MedicalProvider] WHERE [PersonId] = @PersonId) BEGIN
UPDATE [ACP].[ACP].[MedicalProvider] SET [ProviderName] = @ProviderName, [ProStreet1] = @ProStreet1, [ProStreet2] = @ProStreet2, [ProCity] = @ProCity, [ProState] = @ProState, [ProZip] = @ProZip, [ProPhone] = @ProPhone WHERE [PersonId] = @PersonId
END ELSE BEGIN
INSERT INTO [ACP].[ACP].[MedicalProvider] ([PersonId] ,[ProviderName] ,[ProStreet1] ,[ProStreet2] ,[ProCity] ,[ProState] ,[ProZip] ,[ProPhone]) VALUES (@PersonId ,@ProviderName ,@ProStreet1 ,@ProStreet2 ,@ProCity ,@ProState ,@ProZip ,@ProPhone) END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION -- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION -- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully, commit the transac.on COMMIT TRANSACTION
